name: American Kidney Fund (AKF)
description: Gives money to help dialysis and transplant patients pay for treatment if they qualify.

name: American Transplant Foundation
description: Gives grants to help patients pay for medications. Also connects transplant patients with mentors who have been through the same experience.

name: Cost Plus Drugs
description: A low-cost online pharmacy with clear, low prices. Good for comparing cash prices to what you pay with insurance.

name: Donate Life America
description: Connects transplant patients with local resources, events, and support groups across the United States.

name: Drugs.com
description: Look up medications, find who makes them, and connect to their Patient Assistance Programs.

name: GoodRx
description: Free prescription discount coupons. Compare prices at different pharmacies and get instant coupons.

name: HealthWell Foundation
description: Helps patients who don't have enough insurance coverage. Pays for copays, travel costs, and insurance premiums.

name: Medicare.gov
description: The official U.S. government site for Medicare. Compare drug plans and check if you qualify for help.

name: National Alliance for Caregiving
description: A national nonprofit that supports family caregivers. Offers resources, research, and support for people caring for loved ones.

name: NORD RareCare
description: Helps pay for life-saving medications, insurance premiums, and copays. Also helps with testing for rare diseases.

name: PAN Foundation
description: Helps people without enough insurance coverage pay for medications for serious and long-term illnesses.

name: PAN Foundation FundFinder
description: A list of over 150 patient groups that offer helplines, support, and education for specific diseases.

name: Patient Advocate Foundation (PAF)
description: Helps patients with serious illnesses get the care and treatment their doctor recommends.

name: Accessia Health (formerly Patient Services Inc)
description: Helps pay for medications and insurance costs. Also helps you understand your insurance and gives legal advice.

name: PhRMA's Medicine Assistance Tool (MAT)
description: A free search tool to find patient assistance programs from drug companies. It is not a program itself, but helps you find many programs.

name: Rx Outreach
description: A nonprofit pharmacy that sells medications at low prices. Has saved patients hundreds of millions of dollars.

name: TRIO (Transplant Recipients International Organization)
description: The largest group for transplant patients, donors, and their families. Offers local chapters, mentoring, and learning resources.
